job_description:
Company Description

Granola Studios is an Entertainment Technology Startup based in Berlin. Our mission is to bring fans closer to their favourite artists without leaving the house. Real artists perform exclusive and unique live concerts in a motion capture suit and animate their 3D character in a virtual world. Fans can watch these live concerts on PC and Mac (more platforms coming soon) and use their own personalized avatar to explore the festival venue and to interact directly with the artists.

Here is a video with some impressions from our first official live concert with the Belgian artist ICO and the Festival Les Ardentes: https://youtu.be/tyUvt-bTxYI

Job Description
• Build new features in a dynamic startup environment using the latest technologies and tools such as Node, React, AWS, GitHub, Docker, Kubernetes, mongodb
• Take ownership of features, starting with an idea, going through the implementation, following the production deployment and continuously monitoring
• Advise and be part on architecture choices and tools
• Be creative and push new concepts forward

Qualifications
• You already have some experience building applications from concept to production
• You love Javascript and its community
• You are familiar with databases
• You are happy to learn and explore new technologies
• You prefer to focus on the end goal instead of the means to the goal
• You like to build upon existing solutions and use modern technologies and frameworks
• You love shipping code daily to see progress
• Writing tests is something you find very helpful :)

Additional Information

Why you should join us
• An early employee of a promising new Startup about to revolutionize live entertainment
• Many VR headsets, fast computers, nice little office or work from home
• You will probably meet some big artists ;)
• Direct communication with the founders
• You can directly contribute to shaping the product

Logos is a movement supporting the development of the decentralised web. Logos technologies lay the foundations for a freer internet upon which communities can evolve into network states. Each protocol in the Logos stack seeks to empower its users while upholding civil liberties and fundamental freedoms.

The project

Our organization is closely involved in a new community lead project, called Logos, and this role will enable you to focus on its development. Logos is a grassroots movement to provide trust-minimized, corruption resistant governing services and social institutions to underserved citizens. Logos’ infrastructure will provide a base for the provisioning of the next-generation of governing services and social institutions - paving the way to economic opportunities to those who need them most, whilst respecting basic human rights through the network’s design.

In order to promote the ideas behind Logos and its vision, we have created a brand studio called acid.info and you will be part of it. Acid.info is the studio and creative engine within the Logos DAO. Our mission is to build, and ensure, technologies and creativity that supports freedom, justice, and innovation for all people of the world.

The role

As a Web Developer, you will be responsible for the development and technical maintenance of various web-based projects in the studio. Your role will involve execution and writing tests. This is a very collaborative role, where you will work closely with the development team, design team, and studio lead to bring our web projects to life. You will support all technical aspects of every web project (from development and testing to deployment and maintenance)

Responsibilities
• You will be developing and implementing internal tools, including our web frameworks, our design systems implementation in React and other projects
• You will co-write documentation for all the above mentioned products/projects
• You will be responsible for maintaining our open-sourced codebases on Github alongside the rest of team

You ideally will have
• 2-3 years experience in Web Development
• Experience in ReactJS and NodeJs (all in Typescript)
• Good understanding of software architecture
• Experience in implementation of frontend libraries and design systems
• Experience working with Git, Docker and NextJS framework as well as Vercel and/or Netlify
• A strong alignment to our principles: https://status.im/about/#our-principles

Bonus points if
• You are comfortable in working remotely and asynchronously
• You have experience working for an open source organisation
• You have exposure to creative coding (processing, open frameworks, WebGL, writing shaders, p5js)

[Don’t worry if you don’t meet all of these criteria, we’d still love to hear from you anyway if you think you’d be a great fit for this role. Just explain to us why in your cover letter].

Compensation

The expected compensation range for this role is $40,000 - $60,000 (negotiable, dependent on how we assess your skills and experience throughout our interview process.

Hiring process
• Interview with Talent team
• Interview with Florian, Studio Manager
• Interview with Web Developer and Design Studio Lead
• Assessment (paid)

[The steps may change along the way if we see it makes sense to adapt the interview stages, so please consider the above as a guideline!]

Get to know us

Find out about the Logos here: https://logos.co

Want to help solve one of the biggest challenges of our generation?

The pension problem - much like climate change - is slowly getting bigger and often only becomes apparent when it's too late. But it doesn't have to be!

FINABRO's mission is to help everyone do the right thing - for a comfortable and secure retirement in the future. As a start-up in the field of digital company pension plans, we are on a strong growth path. We are now 30 employees, in Austria and Germany, and have an ambitious growth plan.

We love what we do - and we love our team.

Become a part of it and help us solve one of the biggest challenges of our generation.

Web Developer (WordPress, UX/ UI Design)

Full time / part time (min. 30h) - m/w/d

Location: Vienna / Berlin / Remote

Your future role

We are looking for a talented Web Developer (WordPress, UX/UI Design) who will be responsible for designing and executing best-in-class new website builds as well as feature and template updates to our websites.

It’s an opportunity to work on cool projects, learn from some seriously passionate colleagues and expand your skillset.

What you will do:
• Implementation of digital projects from briefing to go live
• Design and implementation of wireframes, UI / UX design
• Setup and configuration of WordPress
• Frontend development
• Creation of web templates
• Working as an interface between Customer Success and the in-house IT department
• Monitoring and implementation of updates
• Plugin and module extensions
• Ongoing support & evaluations of our websites

You bring…
• Completed graphic training in the field of graphic design / web design / web development
• 2+ years of professional and project experience in comparable positions
• Sound knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
• Practical experience with content management systems (ideally WordPress)
• Very good sense for usability and screen design
• Excellent knowledge in the design of responsive websites and web applications
• Confident handling of Figma and React
• Independent work and creative problem solving when implementing projects
• Fluent in English and German

What else we can offer you besides the exciting activities:
• Flexibility: The possibility (also independent of Corona) to work remotely and flexibly in terms of time - because we only employ highly competent people whom we trust; and for us, impact always counts before presence.
• Agility: we are proud of our start-up mindset, we want to try out and implement new things quickly as an agile team.
• Great team: working in a highly engaged, dynamic, competent team with flat hierarchies and a very informal, friendly culture.
• Personal development: Your development is important to us. You'll have regular feedback sessions with supervisors and colleagues, and you'll be surprised how much you learn about yourself.
• No boredom: No day is like the other and holds new challenges

Benefits

Company Pension Plan – Choose your equipment & laptop – Work where you want – No core times – Christmas & New Year's Eve off – Great modern office – Cool Teamevents – Employee perks

Next steps

We offer an attractive and performance-related salary based on qualifications and professional experience: starting from €45,000 (on a full-time basis).

Sounds good? Let us know via bewerbung@finabro.com why you are the ideal candidate for us. We look forward to hearing from you!

Finabro focuses on Insurtech. Their company has offices in Berlin. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://finabro.com

The position is offered full-time and from now on in Berlin

Wonderweblabs is a growing company in the startup hub Berlin. We’re building highly individual and customized solutions in the field of web applications, platforms and mobile applications for our clients. Our target is to develop first class and future leading solutions and to be part of the modern web movement. Since we create tailor-made software for our clients, we develop our applications from scratch with the help of many different software libraries.

Your job

As a full-stack web developer you’ll take part on our mid-sized and large client projects. Additionally, you can drive forward our internal products which help us to build projects faster and more solid. You’ll take part in all steps of the development of our projects, no matter if it is an UI concept, frontend / backend development or basic system administration.
• Plan projects with the team
• Develop semantic frontend-websites
• Develop complex backend functionalities
• Develop database, caching and API structures
• Be responsible for delivering elegant and maintainable code
• Learn every day new things

Your skills

You should bring the following skills and attitudes to be part of the wonderweblabs team:
• Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Javascript
• Deep knowledge about cross-browser compatible websites
• Good knowledge of any language and framework for web development
• A natural feeling for esthetic and usability
• Courage to go for innovation and change and to give constructive feedback
• Analytical way to think and a structured way to work
• Fluency in English

Experiences with the following topics would be desirable and qualify you even more for this job:
• Ruby on Rails
• HAML, SASS and/or Coffeescript
• jQuery, BackboneJS, MarionetteJS, AngularJS
• Mac OS X and/or Linux/Debian/Ubuntu
• Photoshop
• Git
• Jira, Trello, Github, Bitbucket

What we offer

As part of our team you’re working in a start-up like environment with flexible work hours and a modern and creative atmosphere. You’ll get as much coffee, tee, water, coke and ClubMate as you need and want. We offer you a responsible job with exciting and versatile clients. You’ll work with us in our office located in Berlin Oberschöneweide. It’s easy to reach with public transport or by car. Of course you can choose to work at home or wherever you want once in while. Additionally, you’ll get a MacBook Pro for your work, which you can take home and use for private tasks too.

The position is offered as a full-time job.

Dich interessiert einer der Jobs?

Wenn dich einer der Plätze in unserem Team interessiert, sende uns deine Bewerbung per E-Mail oder Post. Neben den üblichen Bewerbungsunterlagen kannst du uns auch gerne Einblicke in deine bisherigen Arbeiten mitsenden.

jobs@wonderweblabs.com

8wonder Holding UG (haftungsbeschränkt), Birkenallee 9, 12683 Berlin

We are looking for a Creative Frontend Developer to complement our design team with someone to translate ideas into smooth experiences. Besides working on cutting edge brands and tech, we offer profit sharing, actual responsibility and a no-BS work culture.

We're looking for a Creative Frontend Developer. Well, what does that even mean?

It means you have all the skills a good developer has – you're an analytical thinker, you're a problem solver, you know your languages and frameworks in and out.

But you also love a beautifully designed website, product or interactive experience – even more, you know that you play a big role in shaping that experience.
• You have an eye for aesthetics. You have an idea of how design works and how it interplays with technology. Wrenching out the last 5% by tweaking easing curves doesn't bore you, but makes you whole.
• You know that Responsive Design is not about adding breakpoints to a website, but about creating elements that adapt to their context.
• You know that design and development have to go hand in hand to really excel, which is why you like to bring your perspective and expertise into the creative process early on.
• You're able to do this because you know everything about HTML, CSS and Javascript. You write semantic code, know when to use a grid over a flex-layout and when it makes sense to use a framework over vanilla Javascript.
• You're familiar with frontend frameworks like React, Vue and Next.js/Nuxt and their pros and cons. You're excited about new technologies, the possibilities that arise with them and the problems they can solve. Ideally, you also have experience with animation-frameworks like GSAP, with WebGL and/or even Three.js.
• You care about accessibility and performance. You know that not every technology will work for everyone. You have your target audience in mind and know when to optimise for touch interactions, that keyboard navigation is a thing and that 500kb might not be a big deal for users in Europe, but very well in rural India.
• You have at least three years of experience working with designers and project managers. You know when to go for a quick hack and when to take the time to do it properly (we always push hard for the latter, but, you know, situations happen).
• Bonus points: You have some backend-experience, you know how a server works and what to do if it doesn't. Even though your work will be focussed on the frontend, having an idea of the rest of the stack certainly is a plus.

We prefer working together and on-site but are used to remote teams and clients. If you can't manage to be around, we will find a way for you to work remotely.

We work with international, decentralized Blockchain projects, German SME's on the path to disrupt the country's old-school industry sector, as well as promising YC startups, usually early-stage and high-tech.

Upcoming projects include building the customer-facing part of a first-of-its-kind WebAssembly package manager, helping a surprisingly innovative German bank building products for the Cryptoverse and serving as the external in-house product team for the next generation of GraphQL tooling.

Overnice focuses on Startups, Technology, User Experience Design, Brand Development, and Blockchain / Cryptocurrency. Their company has offices in Berlin. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://overnice.com

Unternehmensbeschreibung

At teambay (www.teambay.com) we made it our goal to revolutionise company culture with innovative, easy-to-use employee surveys! Our anonymous online-software enables companies to get an insight into the mood, opinions, ideas and innovations of their employees in an individual and smart way. Our analytics allow for results in real-time, smart feedback processes and benchmarks that help identify strengths and development areas. Taking the right actions made easy.

Our goal? We develop a solution for companies that helps creating a successful, innovative and transparent company culture with employees that are engaged and happy.

Founded in 2014, we now have a highly motivated team of 8 innovative, engaged, out-of-the-box people.

You would be the perfect addition to our team as a working student web development (m/f)!

If you love to build a product that changes the way people work and improves every day life in a team that is diverse and innovative: teambay is what you are looking for.

Stellenbeschreibung

Become part of our team and support the creation of a tool that improves company culture and communication for all kind of companies.
• Support in developing new features and enhancements for the product
• Roadmap Planning.
• Plan and execute your own projects with the support of the team.
• Support in maintaining system security and reliability.
• Work with a small, focused team of developers as well as interface with everyone in the company.
• Gain experience managing your own workload and schedule.

Qualifikationen
• Bachelor-/Master studies in computer science, business administration, economics etc.
• First experiences in web development.
• Demonstrated, practical knowledge and experience with Java and Grails (or another MVC framework), as well as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
• Experience with GitHub or other version control tools.
• The willingness to learn fast and deal with new projects and ideas on a daily basis.
• Passion for Start-Ups.
• Self-Organised, motivated and a team player.
• Fluent in English. Additional languages are very welcome.

Zusätzliche Informationen
• A small team of highly motivated innovators.
• Steep learning curve and collaborative working
• The chance to have an impact, make a difference and bring your ideas to life.
• High flexibility with regard to working hours, home office etc.
• A company culture that is defined by openness, innovation, respect, tolerance and trust, just as much as continuous learning.
• Individuals Trainings and support in your personal career plan.

We would love to get to know you! Simply send us your CV and a short motivation and we are looking forward to learn about you and your skills.

See you soon!

Your teambay-Team

job_description:
We are Kolibri Games - a mobile games developer from Berlin. We believe that with the best people, we can make games that players will enjoy for years to come.

Our games have defined the idle genre, and bring enjoyment to hundreds of millions of players all around the world. This is possible due to the talented people who make us who we are. ‘Kolibris’, as we call ourselves, are on a mission to continue making great games and we're looking for new talent to join our team. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.

Freelancer - Web Developer (f/m/d)

Do you enjoy building engaging websites? Have a solid mix of frontend and backend development experience, with an affinity for UX/UI design? Passionate about taking ownership of diverse website tasks and delivering them on schedule? If so, this is the ideal role for you!

We’re looking for a developer with tested business experience to manage and maintain WordPress websites, including front-end tasks like applying custom templates, backend experience with API integrations, and website speed optimization.

Responsibilities
• Manage all website-related tasks and fixes for the company, pertaining to both alterations to the company website, including backend tasks
• Collaborate with other teams to attend to support tasks, and provide the best possible technical solutions
• Analyze the technical feasibility of feature implementation and point out potential issues
• Handle API integrations and website performance optimization

Required skills
• Minimum of 2 years of experience working with publicly visible Wordpress pages
• Experience with Google analytics analysis and working with data
• Experience with Google Data Studio
• Applying designs from Figma, AI, or Adobe XD to Wordpress sites
• Experience in website performance optimization (reducing loading times, for example through CDN)

Desirable skills
• SEO Experience
• UX/UI Design knowledge
• Implementing API’s into backend, and data extraction and processing
• German skills will be considered a plus

Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 40 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability.

We are an international studio, so don’t forget to send in your application in English. Although it is not mandatory, we always appreciate a cover letter stating your motivation to join us.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Your Benefits – We’re game to support you

Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment

Learning Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes

Flexible Working Hours and Home Office – We believe in a good work-life balance

Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time

Kolicard - We offer you a monthly flexible budget of 50 euros that you can use for a gym membership, transportation, shopping etc.

Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin

Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free

Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too

Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc

Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQs and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun

Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team

Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons

mymoria is a modern funeral home

We are rethinking funerals - online and offline. In our funeral boutiques, on our website and in our branches throughout Germany, we offer the opportunity to plan and commission a funeral in full. We work nationwide and offer all common types of funerals such as burial, cremation, burial at sea or tree burial. The organization of a funeral and the arrangement of one's own provisions is often not easy, but with mymoria it becomes more transparent, clearer and above all more customer-friendly.

To strengthen our dynamic team, we are looking for a / a as soon as possible:

Full Stack Web Developer (m/f/d)

Your tasks:
• Further development of our website for our customers and the tools for team to support the customers.
• You play a leading role in the further development of the internal development team
• You actively shape our processes around software and product development to further increase our development speed and quality

Your profil:
• We work as a JAM stack with ReactJS, Gatsby, NodeJS, TypeScript, Express, GraphQL, serverless with AWS, develop apps with React Native, use Google Cloud for Data Intelligence topics. For the websites we use Sass/CSS3 among others.
• You already have at least 2-3 years of experience in backend and front end development (React is desirable) and high quality is important to you
• You like to get involved and are not afraid to speak your mind

What we offer:
• Working in a lean and agile set up and the possibility to bring in your ideas and imagination
• Freedom to experiment, no politics, no technical legacy
• Flexible arrangement of your working hours and a good transport connection
• The opportunity to build the leading funeral home together and transform an entire industry and help people

For employment law reasons, you must have your main residence in Germany, preferably in Berlin. Our office is located in Berlin's government district (5min from HBF).

If we have piqued your interest, feel free to drop by for a coffee. Maybe there are already some exciting projects you can present to us?

We are looking forward to your application!

You want to expand your skills as a developer in to new technologies and fields? Alright!

You feel like you are made for more and want to contribute and shape the future of as small agency? Nice!

Solving new problems and tasks you have not encountered is your home turf? Awesome!

We work with awesome clients like Universal Music, Miles Mobility or the Berlin Unicorn Sennder and are proud to have a small team of two founders, a creative developer and our permanent freelancer team consisting of js FE and BE developers and our designers.

As a development and design agency, we settled in Berlin, offering a modern office in Berlin Kreuzberg, while we develop state-of-the-art headless CMS websites with Storyblok.

With take it_ you will get the opportunity to build the company and it‘s strategy, it‘s clients and it‘s future. We want to provide you with the tools you need, so we can grow together.

What life with take it_ looks like:
• You get to develop and lead projects with our clients
• We know you want to grow, so we support you on your training one becoming better, wherever you need
• We provide you with modern apple hardware
• A fresh brewed Italian coffee in the morning

Tasks

With our team, you will work on javascript features and components for our web based apps and Storyblok cms websites.

Your main task is the implementation of visual UI elements and web animations.

At the same time, we are happy if you want to go deeper into the architecture of our projects.

Requirements

What technologies do we use:
• Vue.js
• Nuxt.js
• React.js
• Next.js
• Typescript
• Tailwind CSS
• GSAP
• Figma
• Storyblok CMS
• Git
• Cypress
• Vite

What we are looking for in you:
• You have at least three years of experience in web development
• You are open-minded and are looking to grow as a team
• A hands-on mentality and a proactive way of working
• You are interested in shaping our agency and culture together with us as a team

Benefits

We don't want to offer you standard benefits like a job bike or BVG ticket. Instead, let's decide together on the benefits that are most attractive to you.

Please only apply if you have at least three years of work experience and are based in Berlin.

Please also add a Portfolio, GitHub or LinkedIn.

We are looking forward to meeting you :)

Silber Salon is the first AI-driven learning platform for older people that was developed in the middle of the 2020 lockdown.

With Lotti as an expert on digital topics, the older generation can also develop their digital skills and become part of the largest community for 55+.

We are now looking for a Freelance Full-Stack Web Developer (m/f/d).

Do you want to make a meaningful difference with your work and help shape one of the most innovative solutions of our time from the ground up?

Then you've come to the right place.

Send us your application and we will get back to you within 24 hours.

Aufgaben

Main responsibilities:
• Architecture design: development of client and server architectures, especially serverless solutions with Firebase and Google Cloud.
• Front-end development: designing responsive web applications with NEXT.js, TypeScript, HTML and CSS/SCSS.
• Database & application management: Management of NoSQL-based databases and applications.
• API development: Creating secure and effective APIs.
• Software testing and bug fixing: Ensuring software quality and performance optimization.
• Security and data protection: Implementation of security standards.
• Mobile-first development: developing mobile features.
• Technical documentation: Creation of detailed documentation.
• Teamwork: Collaboration with the CTO and the development team.

Qualifikation
• Experience: Several years as a full-stack developer with a focus on web technologies.
• Technologies: In-depth knowledge of NEXT.js, TypeScript, Firebase, Google Cloud, HTML, CSS/SCSS.
• Front- and back-end development: Competence in front-end (incl. React) and back-end technologies (e.g. Node.js).
• Database management: Experience with NoSQL databases.
• UI/UX design: Understanding of UI/UX design principles.
• Team player: Effective communication and collaboration in teams.
• Additional qualifications: Experience with payment solutions is desirable

Benefits

Impact: As one of our first 10 employees, you will have the opportunity to help shape fundamental company decisions from the ground up: Product, tech stack, team, brand, culture. Joining so early can be scary - but also very rewarding. This could be the most exciting time of your career.

16 million older people in Germany alone live digitally disconnected and that's exactly what we can change together!

Mentors: We recently raised €1m (pre-seed) and attracted experienced investors and mentors such as FJ Labs, WestTech and IBB Ventures.

Not a 100% fit?

Studies show that men apply for jobs if they fulfill 60% of the criteria on average. Women and other members of marginalized groups, on the other hand, often only apply if they meet all the criteria. So if you might have what it takes, but don't fulfill all the points in the job description, please apply anyway. The main thing is that you're keen!

Send us your application documents with your earliest possible start date or call us if you have any questions: (030) 99 211 880.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Wir sind heute [movers] und morgen [shapers].

Als [movers] sind wir strategische und überzeugende Vordenker*innen in einer der führenden europäischen Management- und Technologieberatungen. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden, treiben Ideen voran und inspirieren. Als [shapers] formen wir konkrete Lösungen und gestalten Prozesse. Wir nutzen innovative Technologien und eröffnen so neue Wege. So ist jede*r von uns stets beides: [mover & shaper]. Gemeinsam sind wir in Deutschland und Österreich rund 2.400 [movers & shapers] und uns alle eint das Ziel, mithilfe innovativer Technologien unsere Zukunft und die unserer Kunden in einem digitalen Europa erfolgreich zu gestalten.

Bei uns warten verschiedenste Projekte aus den Branchen Banking, Insurance, Public Sector, Aerospace, Automotive, Telecommunications, Energy Utilities auf Dich. Du hast bereits Branchen-Präferenzen? Teile sie uns gerne mit.

Vielfalt ist eine wichtige Grundlage unserer Unternehmenskultur. Wir möchten ein inklusives Umfeld schaffen, das die Diversität all unserer Mitarbeitenden berücksichtigt und in dem Du Dich bestmöglich entfalten kannst. Denn wir bei Sopra Steria sind davon überzeugt, dass Deine Individualität der Schlüssel zu einem nachhaltigen Unternehmenserfolg ist.

Bist Du auch ein [mover & shaper]? Dann suchen wir Dich unbefristet als:

Web Developer JavaScript (m/w/d)

Das erwartet Dich als [mover & shaper]
• Du entwickelst komplexe Anwendungen für die Cloud unter Verwendung von Javascript Frameworks, JEE und relationalen Datenbanken
• Außerdem konzipierst Du User Interfaces, Responsive Websites und Mobile Apps
• Du implementierst Schnittstellen zu Drittsystemen und REST-Services
• Du entwickelst kreative Ideen und Lösungen für und mit unseren Kunden und berätst diese zur Planung, Umsetzung und Einführung unserer Softwarelösungen
• Das macht Dich zum [mover & shaper]
• Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, -Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
• Du besitzt Leidenschaft für JavaScript und konntest Deine Kenntnisse während erster beruflicher Tätigkeiten bereits vertiefen
• Du kennst Dich mit Node.js, HTML, CSS, Java und / oder SQL aus
• Idealerweise besitzt Du erste Berührungspunkte mit einigen der folgenden Technologien: ExtJS, Vue.js, React, AngularJS, Jasmine, Git, GitLab, Docker, REST
• Du bist in der Lage, fachliche Anforderungen ganzheitlich zu betrachten und Lösungswege mit unseren Kunden zu diskutieren
• Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab

Das bieten wir [movers & shapers]
• Weiterbildung: umfangreiche fachliche und methodische Trainings inkl. Zertifizierungen sowie vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven innerhalb des Unternehmens
• Work-Life-Balance: Arbeitszeitkonto, hybrides und ortsflexibles Arbeiten innerhalb von Deutschland und bis zu 21 Tage pro Jahr in definierten EU-Ländern, Familienservice, Firmenfitness sowie die Möglichkeit zu einem Sabbatical
• Flexible Urlaubsgestaltung: 30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit zur individuellen Erhöhung oder Verringerung des jährlichen Urlaubs um bis zu 5 Tage
• IT-Equipment: Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Ausstattung von benötigtem Zusatz-Equipment für ein optimales ortsflexibles Arbeiten
• Selbst fahren: Firmenwagen und Dienstfahrrad per Gehaltsumwandlung
• Unser Beitrag: konzernweites Stipendienprogramm für junge Menschen in Indien und viele weitere Corporate-Responsibility-Projekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Beschäftigung und digitale Inklusion
• Unser Mindset: Teamspirit, offene Türen, Duzkultur, gelebte Vielfalt

Kontakt

job_title: Frontend Engineer (MarTech, AdTech & Web Performance) (all genders)
job_description:
Doodle is the world’s leading scheduling platform, helping millions of people instantly set meetings with clients, colleagues, and teams. Tapping into the unique nature of smart scheduling, Doodle simplifies the planning of 1:1 and group meetings for busy professionals. As the world's most trusted online scheduling platform, Doodle attracts more than 25 million visitors each month. Now’s your chance to join 100+ ambitious engineers, designers, product managers, marketers and salespeople on a mission to make great meetings happen. Doodle is headquartered in Zurich, with offices in Atlanta, Belgrade and Berlin.

To strengthen our global team, we are searching for a:

Frontend Engineer (MarTech, AdTech & Web Performance) (all genders)

A mid-level Frontend engineer who will help with developing innovative and reliable software solutions that seamlessly integrate marketing and advertising technologies (MarTech and AdTech), ensuring alignment with business strategies and adherence to project plans, specifications, as well as IT standards and Google Web Development guidelines. This role will be hybrid in our beautiful office in Berlin Kreuzberg.

Your tasks and responsibilities:
• In-depth experience in web technologies, including JavaScript (ES5/ES6+), React, CSS, and HTML (Typescript is nice to have).
• Proficient in API integration, SEO principles, and mobile-first design approaches.
• Familiarity with browser testing, debugging, hydration, and server-side rendering.
• Good knowledge of software architecture, digital marketing principles, and data-driven methodologies.
• Effective communication skills for collaborating with non-technical team members within the marketing department.
• Expertise in Web Performance Optimization and understanding of Google Core Web Vitals.
• Big plus: Experience in Contentful.

Your profile:
• Develop, test, and deploy high-quality software solutions using JavaScript, HTML/CSS, focusing on continuous improvement and high code quality.
• Optimize web applications for performance and user experience, particularly Google Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS, NIP, TTFB, FCP, TBT, TTI).
• Work on AdTech initiatives by implementing and optimizing programmatic ad solutions, enhancing ad delivery and performance on digital platforms.
• Continuously identify opportunities for improvement in web development practices, MarTech and AdTech.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, backend engineers, and project managers, to build and iterate on features that enhance conversion and user engagement.
• Provide technical support to team members, fostering a culture of professional growth and knowledge sharing.
• Implement and monitor A/B testing, troubleshoot bugs, and optimize web performance, especially for mobile users.
• Contribute to the sustainability of IT architecture and maintain system and production documentation.
• Contribute to documentation for current and future processes.
• Support with QA and troubleshoot bugs as needed.
• A desire for education and growth with the latest development techniques and best practices.

We offer:
• Competitive salary
• Remote-friendly culture
• 30 vacation days
• Educational Budget - 1500 euros per year for your personal and professional development + 12 paid training / conference days per year
• Wellbeing Budget - 500 euros per year for your mental and physical wellbeing
• Pension scheme eligibility
• Headspace Membership
• Company lunches/team building events
• Top notch equipment (MacBook, keyboard, trackpad)
• Doodle Premium memberships for you, your friends and your family
• Yearly Doodle retreat for all employees

Hiring Journey
• Applicant initial validation
• 20 min cognitive & personality test
• Culture Fit Interview
• Technical Challenge
• Technical Interview
• Meet the team
• Reference Check
• Offer

So, Get in Touch!

At Doodle, we’re committed to providing an environment of mutual trust and respect, where equal employment opportunities (EEO) are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to age, race, color, disability, religion, gender and sexual orientation. Diversity and inclusion are of utmost importance to us. We’re committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and our products will be. We want to hear from you, so please don’t hesitate to apply!

job_title: Frontend Developer needed for Internet of Things / Marketplace
job_description: We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works. You would like to take ownership on front end decisions, such as frameworks or state-of-the-art technology? You are not hesitant to create a project from scratch and see yourself able to build it with us, reason your way and convince us with your approach? Then you are the expert that we are looking for.Responsibilities- Develop new user-facing features- Build reusable code and libraries for future use- Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs- Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability- Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end- Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders- Ownership of front end development and designated technologiesSkills And QualificationsProficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSProficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQueryGood understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as ReactJS, BabelJS, NPM or AngularJS, etc. - if you have something else on your plate that you would love to use: We are looking forward for it.Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXBasic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to themDegree in information technology / development / programming

Your Role

• Resonsible for clean code and a solid but simple architecture in the frontend
• Translate the design into code and pattern libraries to keep the development efficient and maintainable.
• Create, review and optimize user flows in cooperation with the UX designer

Your Talent

• Work at Berlin Prenzlauer Berg in an awesome startup office
• Be able to work from home however it fits you and the team
• We build talent density and trust, not control

• even if it is once unpleasant to address or decide something.

solexas focuses on Online Travel, Recruiting, Online Video Advertising, Online Shopping, and Internet of Things. Their company has offices in Berlin and Munich. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://solexas.com

We are The Mobile Bank.

Our vision is to build a bank the world loves to use.

Technology and design empower everything we do.

N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. Founded in 2013 by Valentin Stalf and Maximilian Tayenthal, N26 has more than 380 employees and more than 850.000 customers in 17 countries. N26 has raised more than $215 million from investors including Allianz, Tencent, Li Ka-Shing’s Horizons Ventures, Battery Ventures and Valar Ventures, and Valar Ventures, in addition to members of the Zalando management board, Earlybird Venture Capital, and Redalpine Ventures.

Your Role

As a Web Developer, you will join our cross-disciplinary teams to work on N26 projects, such as the revamping of the web application, or the registration process. Our entire tech stack is unified across all web projects so the learning curve from one project to the next is practically non-existent.

If you would like to know more about the said tech stack, you’ll be pleased to know we build and maintain an isomorphic React application, fed with GraphQL, styled with Fela and covered with extensive tests (routes, accessibility, end-to-end…). Nothing but the good stuff!

Your Profile

We are simply looking for good web developers who care about building a good product. So if you want to work on an ambitious web platform supporting N26, powered by a robust yet recent tech stack shaped with fresh design, maybe we would be a good fit for you!

Regarding skills & qualifications, you should obviously know a good deal of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You should be able and eager to work in an efficient and agile framework. And finally, you should care about accessibility, performance and user experience.

What We Offer
• High degree of autonomy
• Crucial role in a highly motivated, talented team
• Individual Professional Development Budget
• Your choice of a new Mac or Windows laptop
• Flat hierarchy and open communication
• Newly designed office in Berlin-Mitte
• A stack of the most modern technologies
• Probably the best cup of coffee in the neighbourhood
• Get Stuff Done Days

So, what are you waiting for? Grow with us and shape our company in the starter phase! We look forward to receiving your online application!

Since we are working with a recruiting software, we only accept online applications via our website (see below).

job_description:
#About Ironhack

Our mission is to be the most outcomes-driven institution in the world at scale! We are a global marketplace for tech talent, where we offer tech bootcamps and partner with companies to impact the lives of our students in a meaningful way. We empower students to create a new career path in tech, get that next promotion, or start their own company.

Quick facts:
• Operations in 10 locations worldwide
• Graduated over 11.000 students
• 200+ global team members
• Venture capital backed

-
#Why join Ironhack

Our culture is characterized by collaboration, which is the way we roll. We like to take on challenges with a smile on our face! We work in flat hierarchies with open communication. Join Ironhack and we guarantee a bootcamp-paced learning experience in a high growth environment, where together we can change the future of education!

-
#About the gig
Are you passionate about the world of Web Development and education? Are you excited about sharing your expertise with aspiring Web Developers? We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Lead Teacher to join our team in Berlin and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our Web Development Bootcamp. As the Lead Teacher, you will lead, inspire, and educate the next generation of web development professionals, helping them gain the skills and knowledge they need to excel in this rapidly evolving field. If you`re ready to make a meaningful impact in the world of Web Development education, we invite you to explore this exciting opportunity with us.

-#Responsibilities
• Oversee the whole academic experience of the Ironhack bootcamp
• Teach at campus Part-Time
• Manage the Teaching Assistants to support the success of the class
• Facilitate a safe, supportive, and energetic community that welcomes the various needs and learning styles of your students
• Challenge students to think strategically as they turn their ideas into web development projects
• Collaborate with Program Managers and Outcomes Managers to ensure that students achieve their professional goals (i.e., job seeking)
• Administer assessment tasks and give students timely and accurate feedback on learning outcomes
• Prepare lesson plans that are balanced and meet the needs of the group and adjusts lesson plans to take account of learning success and difficulties
• Alternate between teaching classroom versus pairs or groups giving clear instructions

Collaborate with Global Team
• Responsible for teaching the curriculum designed by our global education team
• Plan the lessons according to the bootcamp objectives
• Successfully create new techniques and materials, with advice from colleagues
• Work with the global team in the rollout of new teaching materials
• Effectively lead teaching and learning activities to ensure that students reach the learning outcomes set by Education Team

Community Building
• To create a sense of community / Participate in the student experience by joining events
• Facilitate a supportive and energetic community that lasts well beyond the course

-#Must haves
• 2-3 years of experience in the Web Design (HTML / CSS frameworks), JavaScript, Node/Express, MongoDB & Mongoose and any JavaScript front-end framework (React Preferred)
• Fluent in English, as the classes will be imparted in that language; all in-company communication will be in English
• Demonstrates can-do attitude and takes initiative to address problems
• Demonstrates self-awareness of strengths and weaknesses
• Great communication skills and an ability to capture people`s attention :)
• You are organized, reliable, communicative, open to feedback
• You have experience or the ability to coach others and that are involved in the Web Development community

—

If you are not yet logged in here at DISQAVAD as a Member and would like to apply for this role, simply log in or register and click the APPLY button to send or submit your application.

job_title: Web Developer SAP (m/w/d) - Berlin oder remote
job_description:
Oracle Cerner arbeitet mit internationalen Spitzen-Krankenhäusern zusammen. Sechs der besten 10 Kliniken in Deutschland und fünf der besten 10 Kliniken in Österreich verwenden unser Krankenhausinformationssystem i.s.h.med. Gemeinsam mit unseren renommierten Kund:innen stellen wir uns den komplexesten Herausforderungen im Gesundheitswesen. Mit unseren internationalen Teams setzen wir auf neueste, zukunftssichere Technologien, um Menschen und Systeme intelligent miteinander zu verbinden. Mit deinem Talent und deinen Ideen kannst auch du Teil der Veränderung im Gesundheitswesen sein.

In einem Team von erfahrenen Beratern/Entwicklern führst Du Projekte beim Kunden vor Ort durch oder entwickelst Lösungspakete. Als Web Developer bist Du verantwortlich für die Entwicklung, Einführung, Installation und Schulung von Steuerungssystemen/Web-Anwendungen im Krankenhaus beim Kunden. Du steuerst eigenverantwortlich die Erstimplementierung, bist für den Ausbau der Lösungen bei Bestandskunden und den laufenden Support zuständig. Zu Deinem Aufgabenbereich gehört u.a. die Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen, idealerweise SAP Fiori und anschließende Beratung sowie die Konzeption und Umsetzung von kundenspezifischen Lösungen. Auch die Weiterentwicklung/Pflege bestehender Lösungspakete gehören zu Deinem Aufgabenbereich.

Was wir Dir bieten: Gute Gründe, Mitglied der Oracle Cerner Familie zu werden

Auf Dich warten verantwortungsvolle und sinnstiftende Tätigkeiten an der Schnittstelle von Gesundheitswesen und IT. Dank flexiblen und mobilen Arbeitsmodellen sind Beruf und Familie gut zu vereinbaren. Bei attraktiver Vergütung und internationalen Karrierechancen erwartet Dich ein leistungsstarkes Team, das für IT „brennt” und täglich mit Leidenschaft und innovativen Tools für die Verbesserung des Gesundheitswesens sorgt.

Wir leben Karrierechancen und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten und fördern die kontinuierliche Entwicklung aller Mitarbeiter:innen – professionell und persönlich.

Wir feiern Erfolge, lernen aus Fehlern und bieten eine offene, freundliche, inklusive Unternehmenskultur mit Knowledge-Transfer-Sessions und engen teamübergreifenden Kontakten, um den Oracle Cerner-Spirit zu leben.

Das Bieten Wir Dir
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Bedingungen
• Gute Büroanbindung und moderne Arbeitsbedingungen
• Mentoringprogramm
• Vergütung nach dem Bayerischen Metall- & Elektrotarifvertrag (in Deutschland)
• Weihnachts- und Urlaubsgeld
• Leistungsbezogene Zulagen
• 30 Tage Urlaub
• Zuschüsse zum Fitnessstudio und weiteren gesundheitsfördernden Leistungen
• Arbeitgeberfinanzierte Betriebsrente
• Einmalige Auszahlung von Überstunden pro Jahr oder Gleitzeitausgleich
• Zuschüsse zur Kantine
• Reiseversicherung
• Persönliche Weiterentwicklung und verschiedene Lernprogramme
• Flexible Lernzeiten, um dich fortzubilden
• Internationale Karrieremöglichkeiten

Schwerbehinderte Bewerber:innen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt.

Working Environment

Hybrid or Remote

This position offers a Hybrid or Remote working environment. Meaning if you live within a metro area of a Cerner office, you will split working time between a Cerner office and remote. If you are not within a metro area of a Cerner office, you can live and work in your current geographical location and work primarily remote. #Remote

Qualifications Mindestqualifikationen
• Abgeschlossene abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung Informatik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung bzw. Berufserfahrung
• Sehr gute theoretische und praktische Kenntnisse in der Webprogrammierung (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, etc.).
• Umfassende Projekt- und Entwicklungserfahrung bzgl. objektorientierter Programmiersprachen
• Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Wünschenswerte Qualifikationen
• Kenntnisse SAPUI5
• Kenntnisse der ABAP-Programmierung
• Kenntnisse der SAP BW Datenmodellierung und Reporting
• Kenntnisse über Krankenhausprozesse in Deutschland und/oder Österreich

Erwartungen
• Reisebereitschaft: 20 %

For more than 10 years, 3Q has developed and operated a robust and high-performance SaaS platform for video
management and streaming.

We are specialists in streaming technologies and high availability. Using our in-house platform, we broadcast live and
on-demand content for leading content providers worldwide. With full GDPR compliance, innovative features, multiple

job_description:
About Yassir

Yassir is the leading super App for on demand, ride-hailing, last-mile delivery, payment services and more, set to change the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across multiple countries. It has raised $150 million in Series B funding, five times what it raised in its previous priced round last November with world class investors such as BOND and Y Combinator, which is the precursor of the likes of Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Doordash, among others.

We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.

About the role

We are looking for a senior front-end developer to join our tech hub in Berlin and support our growth and expansion. You will be part of the engineering team, working with a high-quality code base and the latest tools, and you will promote your skills to be an expert in complex frontend development in React.JS. Your primary focus will be the development of web applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.

About your role as Frontend Developer
• Design and build web applications using React.js
• Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
• Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
• Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
• Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
• Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to our technology, algorithms and products.
• Work with the engineering and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution
• Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule

About your experience
• Must have technical skills with at least 5 years of experience
• Language: Javascript
• Framework: React.JS, Express.JS
• Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notification
• Web architecture: Rest and restful APIs, micro-services
• Version control: GIT
• Nice to have technical skills (Strongly advised)
• Containers: Docker, Kubernetes
• Caching, Redis server
• Scaling, Web load balancing
• Experience in a rapidly growing company in the mobility, on-demand, or fintech space is a plus
• BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant field

Why should you join Yassir
•    You will be part of one of the first Algerian startups to go through the Y Combinator program and one of the fastest-growing tech companies in North Africa. We are current in +30 cities in Africa and Europe
•    Attractive salary and you even get a stake in the company
•    Subsidized public transit pass
•     Have a lasting impact on our company's culture
•    Perfect timing with renowned investors to build something great
•    Extremely steep learning curve with own responsibility and intensive guidance
•    Make a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of Africans

Do you want to become part of our first-class team? You should definitely send us your application.

Canonical is a pioneer in the digital workplace, established in 2004 with a global, remote-first policy that has delivered world class open source and sets the pace in cloud, developer and IoT technology.

We want Canonical to remain the best at remote work. It's part of our enjoyment of our mission - both to deliver the world's best free software, and to push the boundaries of 21st-century work and collaboration. It seems that everyone had a taste of remote work in the past few years, but at Canonical we think it can continue to evolve and improve. We want to take our remote-first workplace to the next level, and are investing in the next wave of tooling to support and streamline our operation.

Our goal is to improve the state of the art even further in key business processes for a distributed team: hiring, collaboration, communication, learning, documentation, development, and open source development. We want to understand our distributed teams as well as we could understand co-located teams. We want to help them work better, be happier, and make better decisions.

Our Workplace Engineering team of web and analytics specialists build new tools, dashboards and analytics that empower colleagues, managers and executives to make better decisions and deliver better work.

To be successful in this team you must be an expert in two or more of the following:
• Backend web service programming in Python and Node.JS
• CSS and front-end web programming with React
• Data analytics and statistical analysis
• Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
• Data visualisation

The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow’s tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the business and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of working at Canonical. In some cases, we might productise these capabilities as SAAS for other tech companies.

As a Senior Web Engineer at Canonical, you need an analytical, data-driven mind and a passion to connect and make sense of interesting data from APIs. We focus heavily on the collection of metrics, optimising processes, and ways of working across Canonical. You need to demonstrate leadership, excellence, and consistency, and will mentor others in the team.

What you’ll do
• Design and deliver web based systems and SAAS
• Provide new insights into the Canonical workplace experience
• Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
• Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
• Write high-quality code to create new features
• Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
• Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
• Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
• Estimate work, set goals and meet them
• Write briefs, epics, and specifications and understand risks
• Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks annually
• Understand completion criteria and push work to completion
• Help mentor other engineers
• Work to reduce complexity
• Take on technical lead responsibilities to drive to completion
• Own a functional area of your project/product
• Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices
• Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
• Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
• Database design and architecture for connected systems
• Developing new and improved working practices for the company
• Providing tooling to support optimised processes

Who you are
• You are knowledgeable and passionate about web and software development
• You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
• You try to learn and use web best practices in your work
• You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
• You take web best practices into account with your work
• You have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
• You have solid experience working in an agile development environment
• You drive work to completion
• You take operational considerations (CI, updating, monitoring, observability, life-cycle management) into account
• You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
• You follow industry trends and new technologies
• You’re capable of representing your team as a subject matter expert
• Have an interest in data visualisation
• Enjoy working with many APIs to help many teams across Canonical
• You enjoy driving process improvements within the company

What we offer
• An opportunity to shape a company and products with a strong influence in the open source community
• An inclusive work environment with friendly people, broadly skilled from UX design to copywriting
• Learning and development
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual leave
• Priority Pass for travel

Interview process
• Your application will be reviewed by our team
• You will be sent a set of written interview questions and your answer will be reviewed anonymously
• You will be asked to take a standardised aptitude test
• A short interview with a team member
• An HR interview
• You will be asked to complete a coding test
• A series of four more detailed technical interviews
• Hiring manager interview
• Offer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#LI-Remote

Read about Deta first!

At Deta we are trying to push the limits of two critical technologies — personal cloud computing & operating systems — for developers and users around the world.

We are looking for a Senior Frontend Designer to lead the development of delightfully snappy web application experiences! Pushing web technologies to their limits is core to the job.

Your Role
• Design and implement fast, modern, and efficient web applications
• Building new user-facing features with beautiful and scalable UI components
• Analyze and optimize the performance of our existing applications
• Spec, implement and maintain the browser SDKs for our cloud services
• Work closely with our product team on new experimental user/developer interfaces
• Wear many hats. We are a team of generalists, so you shouldn’t be scared of touching the backend from time to time or writing a blog post about a new feature

Your Profile

The following profile is a just suggestion, and we will hire frontend designers who don’t satisfy all the requirements but are amazing at something important.
• Seniority: +3 years of experience in JavaScript & TypeScript
• Highly organized understanding of the broader and end-user perspective
• Comfortable breaking open and understanding the inner workings of web frameworks like React, Vue & Svelte
• You pay attention to details and have a sense of great user experience, and feel when something is off
• Readiness to take slow 100ms times down to 25ms
• Understanding of HTTP & browser-based JavaScript engines and behavior
• Interest in and some experience with WebAssembly is a plus

Our Typical Process
• Initial call
• Call with the Deta CEO
• Trial project
• De-brief & references
• Offer

   To apply, please follow the step guide.

We’re offering a position for an intermediate to senior level full stack developer. You will join a small and lean team where you will have a chance to make an impact right from the start. Setting is one of the leading flex office providers in Germany that operates a marketplace that aims to make space more accessible to startups and fast growing companies.

Tasks

You will help maintain and extend our software components for modernizing the entire office rental experience from space discovery, contracting, and payments to handover, support and access processes.

Requirements

Hard skills

We’re looking for an experienced developer, who will play a critical role in maintaining our back office applications and advancing our user facing office marketplace. You should be well versed in object oriented languages and popular web frameworks like Rails, Django or React. Practical experience with relational databases, interest in data modeling and knowledge of test driven methodologies are also essential.

• Experience with Javascript, CSS, HTML, Python or Ruby are essential

• Proven experience with writing and maintaining code for both frontend and backend

• Decent level of UI/UX knowledge

• Excellent forward-thinking and initiative skills

• Good time management and organization skills

• Ability to visualize and plan user-interface improvements

• Degree in computer science or similar qualification in software development

Soft skills

Software is a team sport. So besides a strong analytical and problem solving mentality, you should have a collaborative spirit and show responsibility and ownership towards colleagues and customers. Getting things done is a quality that we practice and appreciate throughout the company.

Benefits

What we offer:
• A competitive remuneration package with fixed and variable components
• Weekly team lunch. Enjoy delicious, healthy lunch with the team and learn about the crew
• Intensive coaching from experienced serial entrepreneur with steep learning curve
• Part of a dynamic and fast-growing company with flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and the opportunity to make a strong strategic and conceptual contribution
• Always Learning. Team-based training and coaching, as well as a yearly book allowance to expand your knowledge

About Us:

At Setting, our mission is to connect people with spaces. We help entrepreneurs, businesses and companies find, lease and transform oﬃce space for modern work.

We want to bridge the gap between the traditional values of real-estate owners and the modern needs of a new generation of entrepreneurs, startups and fast growing companies.

Our vision is to make space work. But our vision of space is more than just renting, brokering, or leasing spaces. What we see is that the traditional real estate market is not made for today’s generation of companies. Dynamic companies are seeking fresh, flexible, and pragmatic solutions in an evolving real estate market. Through understanding what they want, we want to help entrepreneurs, companies, and organisation find the perfect space to work at their maximum potential.

Our Values:

Our core values are the beliefs and principles we share. These are the elements that best describe the type of company we are and continue to strive to be.
• Help each other grow. We personally commit to the success and development of our team, and actively involve others in decisions and plans that aﬀect them.
• Be dynamic. Our work is never the same one day to another, and we thrive through thinking about the transformation of the real estate market.
• Use honesty. We’re open to personal change, and strive for our environment to be as transparent as possible.
• Get things done. Every detail matters. We’re reliable, and we pick our own stuff up. That means we find a solutions to any problem.
• Value openness. We’re not afraid to ask the right questions, and we are true to ourselves and each other.
• Don’t forget to laugh. Smile. Have fun, enjoy the task at hand, and promote an energising and optimistic environment.

Your mission

HelloBetter is a pioneer in the field of digital healthcare. For more than 10 years, we have been developing evidence-based digital health applications for the prevention and treatment of mental health conditions. Our applications cover a variety of areas, including stress management, depression, problematic alcohol use, panic disorder and anxiety, vaginismus, and sleep disorders.

Six of HelloBetter's ten applications are approved as digital health applications. They are available free of charge by prescription to all insured adults in Germany.

As Senior Frontend Developer (m/f/x), you will be at the forefront of a challenging intersection between technology, UI, and research, where you'll be responsible for building applications that help people improve their mental health. Drawing on your experience with frontend technologies such as React.js, Next.js, TypeScript, and more, you'll design and develop scalable products that guarantee a pixel-perfect UI across multiple browsers, ensuring that our products are both user-friendly and safe to use, delivering an outstanding user experience.

You find more information on HelloBetter and the Engineering Team in our HelloBetter Handbook.

Reports to: Leonardo Couto (Engineering Manager)
Talent Acquisition: Julia Cramer
Salary Band:
Professional IC L2: 55 - 72k € (gross, fix) + VSOP (15% of annual gross salary)
Senior Professional IC L3:72 - 85k € (gross, fix) + VSOP (20% of annual gross salary)
Remote-first Culture: This position is part of a research project supported by the state of Brandenburg. Residency around Brandenburg/Berlin is therefore necessary.
Offices: Potsdam, Berlin

Your profile

You thrive on opportunities in the conception of new features and technical challenges. Additionally, you possess excellent communication skills, ensuring that every detail is accurately conveyed and nothing gets lost in translation.

Why us?

Research & Evidence

About us

HelloBetter was founded under the name GET.ON Institut für Online Gesundheitstrainings GmbH by internationally recognized researchers and psychologists in 2015. In more than 30 randomized-controlled studies, HelloBetter has developed and evaluated 10 online programs from eight specific problem areas in cooperation with Leuphana University, Friedrich-Alexander University Erlangen-Nuremberg, the Free University of Amsterdam, Harvard University and other partners. These programs serve both the prevention and treatment of classic mental illnesses such as depression, anxiety or panic disorders, but also cover topics such as vaginismus or chronic pain. This gives HelloBetter the broadest study base of all providers.

In the meantime, six therapy programs from HelloBetter have been approved by the German Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices (BfArM) as digital health applications and are available free of charge on prescription for all adults with health insurance in Germany. The work of the expert team has been published in international journals (including The Journal of the American Medical Association) and recognized with various awards (including, Wilhelm Exner Award in Psychology 2016, EFPA Comenius Award 2017, Digital Health Award 2018, EU Compass Good Practice 2018 in Mental Health).

The company is based in Berlin and Hamburg and employs more than 100 people.

job_description:
We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to collaborate directly with our CTO and the product team. If you're someone who thrives in the fast-paced environment of a small team and is excited about playing a pivotal role in shaping a product of an early-stage startup, then this opportunity is made for you.

dlt is an open-source library that automatically creates datasets out of messy, unstructured data sources. You can use the library to move data from about anywhere into most of well-known SQL and vector stores, data lakes, storage buckets, or local engines like DuckDB. It automates many cumbersome data engineering tasks and can be handled by anyone who knows Python. More details in this Hacker News article.

dltHub is based in Berlin and New York City. It was founded by data and machine learning veterans. We are backed by Dig Ventures and many technical founders from companies such as Hugging Face, Instana, Matillion, Miro, and Rasa.

Your Task and Responsibilities:
• Design and implement our platform web application using Fast API, Next.js, and a bunch of various database and streaming backends
• Offer support to our platform users in Slack
• Maintain the open source project with the team (e.g., review PRs, resolve issues, talk with community contributors, etc.)
• Contribute to the dlt core, including code, tests, and documentation

Who You Are:
• You really like Python and are fluent in writing Python code (e.g., Python typing, unit testing, writing docstrings, etc.)
• Proven experience with Python web frameworks, such as Fast API or Django, as well as the OpenAPI specifications
• Proven experience with frontend frameworks, such as next.js.
• Experience with database modeling and Python ORMs, such as sqlalchemy.
• You have a degree in computer science, data science, or other equivalent experience
• You are familiar with GitHub workflows (e.g., pull requests, code reviews, CI/CD services, etc.)
• You are based in Berlin and willing to work in our office regularly
Nice to Have:
• Experience with DevOps (e.g., CI systems like GitHub Actions, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP/Digital Ocean, etc.)
• Experience with OLAP Databases, such as Clickhouse, Pinot, or Druid
• Experience with machine learning (e.g., the toolset, the workflows, practical applications, etc.)

We are office first company but give you plenty of opportunities for deep work and work from home. We prioritize automation, starting with our own tasks before extending them to others.
• Dedicated "no meeting days" to help the team focus on their most impactful work
• Building connections with the team in person is crucial, so we host regular team lunches and events
• As we work often from the Berlin office, we cover your public transportation ticket
• We are deeply committed to your personal and professional growth, so we have an annual budget for learning and development.
